Detailed Description

It has implements the drawing of a special list item separator for Rosie style list view.

By default, a top round and a bottom round are added to a list. In order to use separator in the middle, implement your own ListItemSeparable class and set it to your list item view's tag.

The following is an simple example for GridWidget.

We have a string array which will be displayed on GridWidget: 

 Vector<String *> *pStrings = new Vector<String>();
 pStrings->append(new String("Mauritania"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Mayotte"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Mexico"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Moldova"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Mozambique"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Montserrat"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Morocco"));

Before we create GridWidget, we need to implement our own ItemProvider, and override getItemWidget and createItemWidget function:

 class MyItemProvider: public ItemProvider {

 Vector<String *> &mpStrings; //member variable to point32_t strings.
 Page *mPage;

 const static int32_t32_t TEXT_INDEX = 1;

 public:
     MyItemProvider(Vector<String> &pStrings, Page *page)
         : mpStrings(pStrings), mPage(page) {
     }

     Widget *createItemWidget(int32_t32_t index) {

         LinearController *controller = new LinearController(mPage);
         TextWidget *text = new TextWidget(mPage);
         text->setId(TEXT_INDEX);
         controller->addWidget(text);
         return controller;
     }

     Widget *getItemWidget(Widget *itemWidget, WidgetController *parent, int32_t32_t index) {
         if (itemWidget != NULL) {
             TextWidget *text = dynamic_cast<TextWidget *> (itemWidget.findWidgetById(TEXT_INDEX));
             if (text != NULL && index < mpStrings->size()) {
                 text->setText(*(mpStrings[index]));
             }
         }
         return itemWidget;
     }
 };

After implement our own provider, we can start to create GridWidget and show in Page: 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence *savedInstanceState) { 

     GridWidget *pGridWidget = new GridWidget(this);
     MyItemProvider *pProvider = new MyItemProvider(this, pStrings);
     pGridWidget->setItemProvider(pProvider);
 
     LinearController *pController = new LinearController(this);
     pController->addWidget(pGridWidget);
     
     Sence *pScene = Scene::SceneFactory(this);
     pSence->attachController(pController);
 }

The selection may be moved so that it does not int32_tersect the faded edges. The grid is then filled upwards and downwards from there.

childrenTopWhere to start drawing children

virtual void gaia::ui::GridWidget::fillGap ( bool  down) [virtual]

Fills the gap left open by a touch-scroll.During a touch scroll, children that remain on screen are shifted and the other ones are discarded. The role of this method is to fill the gap thus created by performing a partial layout in the empty space.

Parameters:
downtrue if the scroll is going down, false if it is going up

bool  flow

gaia::core::Widget* gaia::ui::GridWidget::moveSelection ( int32_t  delta,
int32_t  childrenTop,
int32_t  childrenBottom 
) [private]

Fills the grid based on positioning the new selection relative to the old selection.

The new selection will be placed at, above, or below the location of the new selection depending on how the selection is moving. The selection will then be pinned to the visible part of the screen, excluding the edges that are faded. The grid is then filled upwards and downwards from there.

Parameters:
deltaWhich way we are moving
childrenTopWhere to start drawing children
childrenBottomLast pixel where children can be drawn
Returns:
The view that currently has selection

selectedIs this position selected?
recycledHas this view been pulled from the recycle bin? If so it does not need to be remeasured.
